Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BoyZagreb
Reviews.Content: greatest advantage of the hotel is good location Although our room had a view on the main street there were no problems with noise furniture is a bit worn but clean room satisfying breakfast all staff does not speak English The hotel will be closed from November to March to renovations

Reviews.Title: “Central location. Brilliant service. Moderately priced.”
Reviews.Author: OnceInALongWhile
Reviews.Content: Granvia is a good hotel in central Barcelona. Location: Barcelona is a moderately large city by European standards, and any tourist would want to get the most out of their visit by choosing a hotel as close as possible to the monuments/museums in the city centre. Hotel Granvia is located on one of Barcelona's main roads, the eponymous Gran Via. Even better, it is just about 100m north east of the Placa de Catalunya, the primary square and bus terminus in Barcelona. The Las Ramblas shopping-and-cafes street is only another 100 metres away, and the La Pedrera (Barcelona's most famous Modernist building and one of the most important museums) is only about 5 minutes' walk northwards. Going by the location, Granvia is a brilliant choice. Room: Clean and efficient. European standards of room size apply of course, meaning that the rooms will never 'meet' one's expectations of size, let alone exceed. Together with the room's small size comes the problem of cardboard walls, which may be disconcerting for light sleepers. I woke up one morning hearing my phone ring, but in fact it wasn't mine, it was actually the person's next door. This is normal for Europe, so it shouldn't come as a surprise to some travelers. My room had adequate cupboard space. The toilet was clean and the shower worked well. There were no free electric sockets in the room, so I had to disconnect the TV and twiddle my thumbs as my laptop got charged. Equally disappointing was the view from the window - there's a whitewashed blank construction wall about 10 metres from the hotel's west-facing wall. Service: Staff was very courteous and helpful. On arrival I wasn't handed the standard form that hotels normally ask guests to fill in. The elevator is large enough for heavy luggage. Wi-fi was free and worked very well; speeds were good enough to support voice and video chat on Skype, but Youtube videos took time to buffer. The breakfast spread was good and came free with three nights' stay. In summary: Highly recommended. Tip: Granvia is part of the Nunez i Navarro group (nnhotels.com), a chain of 5-10 hotels in Barcelona (perhaps other cities as well?). If you are looking for a hotel with similar service values but in a different location, you might want to check out their other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hotel Granvia”
Reviews.Author: bicyclebetsy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Granvia. Because of a recommendation in the 2012 Rick Steves guidebook on Spain I booked online directly with the hotel. It was just what we wanted: quiet, comfortable, wonderful location and great breakfast. The staff was courteous and helpful. We asked for and got a lovely room in the back of the hotel overlooking the patio. It would have been even better if it had not rained. It was very easy to book online. In fact, I had to go back and change the booking when I noticed that I had only booked a room for one person. The directions included in the booking enabled us to take the Airbus into Plaza de Catalunya, and walk to the hotel with our luggage. Because of our early flight out we asked for a wakeup call, which was done by a real person, and a taxi, which was at the front desk when we came down at 4:30 A.M. The room was a little worn, but very clean and comfortable with a good bed, and room to move around. There was a safe, and free wifi. The location was wonderful: We were able to walk to the port on Las Rambles. To the Barcelona Cathedral and Barri Gothic. To the Palau de la Musica Catalana for a performance. To the Picasso Museum and to Antoni Gaudi designed apartments of the Casa Mila and the Casa Batllo. For the Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, and Montjuic we used the Hop-on Tourist bus accessed at Placa Catalunya. The subway was nearby, but we did not use it. There were several dining options available close by. I would recomend this hotel to anyone on their own in Barcelona. We would certainly stay there again. Mary E. Bures

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ygwhitty
Reviews.Content: We werent sure what to expect upon our arrival in Barcelona since we had only seen photos of this hotel. We were so pleasantly surprised! The location is right in the middle of the city and pretty much all the places you want to visit. Streets all of full of shops, Las Ramblas 10 minutes away, and 2 of Gaudi´s most famous work just blocks away. Carlo at the front desk was so helpful on our first day...gave us a map and explained the city area along with the metro system. Very clean rooms and cleaned daily. Breakfast was always good and the coffee was the best. It was a great value and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LifeOfRileeee
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel recently as a base for a week's holiday in Barcelona. I was very pleased with the location and the facilities. The hotel could not be better located in my opinion. Not right on Las Ramblas but a 5 minute walk away from the start of it. Also a 3 minute walk away was Placa ce Catalunya where you could get a bus directly to the airport, use left luggage facilities and book excursions and trips at the Tourist Information office. There is also a metro station right outside the hotel entrance. I didn't use it myself but the hotel has a beautiful sitting room full of chandeliers and lovely furnishings. The single room I had was not massive but big enough for my purposes. Shower was always hot, wifi was always fast and working and my room was well cleaned every day. My breakfast was not included so I only had it once (it was very good but I didn't want to pay €10 every day) - instead I went round the corner to a cafe above a bookshop on Pau Claris where you could get a light breakfast for under €5. Overall, a very good hotel with an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Your experience may vary (greatly) depending on your room”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Expat_07
Reviews.Content: I tayed here for a conference and had a mixed experience. Generally speaking this is a nice, European style hotel in a fairly good location. It's close to Las Ramblas, but not right on it, so you don't get the crowds. It is close to several metro lines, so getting around Barcelona from the hotel is pretty easy. The staff is nice, and they do make an honest effort to be helpful. The rooms are typical European, and many (if not all) have two single beds. The beds are very, very firm, so depending on your personal preference, that'll be either good, or not. The rooms are clean but have minimal amenities. On the downside, the walls are thin. I could actually hear the person next door snoring as if they were next to me. Note that this hotel, like so many others in the region do not have irons in the room. The hotel will press your shirt for you, and they do have laundry services as well. They have a fridge with the usual stocked items of beer, wine, soda, and water. The biggest issue, and what will impact your opinion of this hotel is that the rooms differ widely in their acceptability. The room I was originally assigned was on the interior of the hotel, overlooking a closed up 'courtyard' that overlooked the glass roof of the lobby area. As it was winter, the hotel had shut down the A/C, but unfortunately by doing so, they removed any possibility of air circulation, or fresh air. The week we were here was warm, but there was no way to cool down the room, and when I asked the hotel, they said to open a window, but due to the fact that the interior courtyard is totally closed off, there is no possibility to get fresh air. The second big problem I had with the room was that the sewer smell came in through the bathroom. Again, without the ability to circulate air, this made being in the room very unpleasant. When a new room opened up (3 days later) it was on the outside of the hotel and had a view of the external courtyard. What a difference! Fresh air, no sewer smell, a nice view of the courtyard. Fantastic! Check below for what rooms to ask for, and what to avoid. In general, make sure you do not get a room on the interior part of the hotel. To help you, here are the rooms you should ask for: 110, 111, 112 (all have small balconies) or 210 (my room), or 213. When making a reservation, be sure to ask for a room on the back side of the hotel. Rooms on the side will have no view, and rooms on the front will have the street noise. Rooms to avoid are 116, 211 & 212 and any interior rooms on the 3rd or 4th floors (I didn't see a room layout map for those floors) As for the rest of the property, the breakfast is a simple buffet, but good. They have a small internet kiosk area, but I didn't need to use it as they have excellent wifi coverage throughout the hotel. Lastly, next door is a small tapas bar that is open late and has good food and some local beer that is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bezetka
Reviews.Content: Impressive location and very good price, Small window facing air shaft.Skimpy pilows,bathrooms are very tired. Annoing noise from the building next door-from 8am to 7pm. I don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JubilantBeggar
Reviews.Content: The location of Granvia is excellent. Literally outside of your doorstep is the subway, which allows you to quickly travel all over Barcelona. Within a couple minutes you can walk to the Ramblas and Playa de Catalunya (great people watching spot and drop off point for the airport bus). If high end shopping is your thing, you are only a minutes walk away from Chanel, Armani, etc. If you want to see one of Gaudi's masterpieces, Casa Mila is a 5 minute walk up the road. The hotel was running a promotion during our stay, so they included breakfast in the room rate. It was excellent! Pastries, meats, cheeses, fried eggs, bacon, espresso machine, breads, fruit, yogurt, milk and cereal, 4-5 different kinds of juices, etc. Easily the best breakfast I've seen provided by a hotel in Europe. The rooms were clean and the price was right. The walls are thin, so we could hear a yelling little kid next door, but that's par for the course in Europe. The building next door is performing construction, so from about 8am-7pm you can hear a fair amount of construction activity. We wer gone most of the time, so it wasn't a huge bother. All that to say, we'd definitely stay here again if we find ourselves in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aidaco
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights after our Mediterranian cruise. We were very happy to find this hotel. Beyond my expectation. Great location, walking distance to the square, La Rambla, Tourist bus, etc. Reasonable price for a great hotel. Breakfast was good, Staffs are friendly, helpful and polite. I would definitely stay again in this hotel next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a Barcelona Holiday !”
Reviews.Author: artemis_zeus
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely hotel in November 2011 and absolutely loved it ! It is the perfect combination of an ideal location to visit Barcelona, and a historic gem oozing with character and atmosphere ! Our room was beyond our expectation - huge and well appointed (see the pics). Our breakfast was included in our on-line direct book reservation and it was a delicious and money saving way to start our long days of visiting this incredible city. The hotel has a royal yet intimate feel and I felt like I was living in a period movie. You can get a hip modern hotel anywhere in the world, but this atmosphere is unique and historic. When I return to Barcelona I wont look any farther than the HOTEL GRANVIA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilikehawaii
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights with my ten-year old daughter. The hotel has a very convenient location - close to Metro, buses, and lots of sightseeing spots. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet has a variety of pastry, bread, hams, eggs, fruits, juice, coffee, and tea. The room we had is small, but big enough for us. The bathroom is clean. There are a safety deposit box, TV, wi-fi, and a fridge in the room. We stayed at the street side with a mall balcony, which was requested by me when making the reservation because we'd like to see the Christmas lights on the street. The noise level is acceptable to me, but if you have a low tolerance level with noise, you may want to stay at the other side facing the garden. We would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels More Like a Hostel”
Reviews.Author: BinkieM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small and feels more like a hostel than a hotel. I took a chance on a single room and it was TINY. I am not a big person, 5'4", average weight. The worst part was the shower. It is impossible to call it a bathtup because it was no more than 3 feet. It was difficult to step into. The first room I went into had a window that faced an airshaft and wall, absolutely claustrophobic. So I went to a second room which particially faced the patio. It was not an unobstructed view, this room partically faced the airshaft and wall. There is another review that calls this room 1950 decor. I would agree. I generally like old-fashioned but this was well below "shabby chic." The key to the room was very old fashioned they should convert to magnetic keys. The location was good and the service was acceptable. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Sara923
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Granvia with my mom and dad in late November 2011. The location of the hotel was very nice! It was walking distance to Paisaje de Gracia and Plaza Catalunya/las Ramblas (don't worry, las Ramblas is actually a safe place, despite comments otherwise). The metro was nearby. Plenty of nice shops/restaurants. The hotel was charming inside. Internet access was free. We initially had a balcony room facing the street but requested a room further away from the street for less noise. It was perfect...no issues with noise there! We never had breakfast in the hotel, but a few other guests we had talked to said they enjoyed it. The cleaning service was nice and the individuals at the front desk were helpful with directions. Some were more friendly than others though. I particularly liked Carlos. All in all, this was a nice stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “old Europe charm + location”
Reviews.Author: kikaan
Reviews.Content: This hotel dates to the 30's . It has kept all features of that age without appearing worn or derelict. The breakfast hall looks like a ballroom. There is also a huge "salon'" which could be the background for a film about European nobility at the turn of the last century. And : it is situated right behind the corner of the very center of Barcelona on a broad boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Earwigo321
Reviews.Content: Location 9/10 - Very central, shops, underground, airport bus and old town all within 5 minutes walk or less Rooms 6/10 - All are rather old and worn but large and have everything in them one would expect. Lighting was poor in our room and there was only a tiny window which made the room a bit depressing Beds 5/10 - Small and not that comfortable Bathroom 6/10 - Bath and shower but again rather old Public areas 8/10 - Very grand and palatial - see this video on YouTube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qzd1L5eK_eg Breakfast 8/10 - Plenty of choice in a very grand setting Staff 8/10 - Polite and helpful, spoke good English Value for money 8/10 - We paid £80 for a twin room B & B in November but would only return if the price was no more than £100.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: VacationOslo
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I'm staying at this hotel. The location is perfect, close to the airport bus, near La Rambla and close to train/metro station at Placa Catalunya. The public area of the hotel is very nice. The rooms are a bit worn. The beds are hard and noise from both the hallway and the street outside is noticable. If it is disturbing would be individual I guess. The rooms may need some rehabilitation, though the rooms looks clean, and there is wooden floor, as we are used to in Scandinavia. Wall-to-wall-carpets is not very nice I think. The breakfast was nice and was included in the hotel price. It was also possible to buy breakfast for approx 10-11 Euros pr person if it wasn't included in the hotel price.

Reviews.Title: “Pass On This One”
Reviews.Author: cokeguy72
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was very cramped - even by European standards - and the bed was nothing more than a thin matress on top of a wooden base. The courtyard view was nothing more than a "void" in the middle of the hotel's square layout. The hotel is located very close to desirable Ramblas area but the noise, unsafe surroundings, and old & dirty exterior make this a bad choice. Better hotel choices exist only a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Not what is portrayed by its website”
Reviews.Author: Simon L
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room for 3 nights, got given a twin room and told there were no more rooms left when I went back down to front desk to enquire about changing. It may have been a nice room once - perhaps in 1950. Not a nice antique room or a modern room, just one with 1950s veneered wood and broken fittings, and the lighting of a hospital for atmosphere. There was a light above each bed, but only one switch to operate both, so it was all or nothing. Room was airless but the windows opened in to some kind of roofed atrium, and not a pretty one at that, so no air circulation. The aircon had no effect in moving air around. TV was in a different 'room' that could not be seen from the beds, and there was no chair to sit on in that room to watch it, so lucky I only wanted to see a weather forecast. Breakfast was good, front desk staff were friendly. That was the best of it - checked out after the first night (and so got charged for breakfast.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: alexsep
Reviews.Content: We chose Gran Via to stay five days prior to our cruise. It is an excellent hotel with a very good location near Plaza de Calunya and las Ramblas, near the metro an train station. Our room was simple but comfortable and very clean. The staff great, breakfast very good. October 23 to October 28 2011. Alejandra

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: curley207
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, 2 of which were the Romantic Package (includes a bottle of wine and a wonderful meal at one of the other hotels in the chain). Our room was spacious for Europe and very comfortable and clean. The location was perfect - we walked to the Palau de Musica de Catalana, Gaudi's Casa Mila, and Las Ramblas. Only a block and a half from Placa de Catalunya where the Aerobuses stop from the airport - don't get a taxi from the airport - the taxi was about 34 Euros, the bus was 5.3 Euros each and stopped so close you could easily walk to it in less than 10 minutes. The staff was wonderful and helped us with dining and suggestions about getting around town. The metro is a 2 minute walk and we got a 10-ticket card which we both used for 5 round trip tickets. The metro is really easy to use and we never felt unsafe. Because of loud construction next door, we asked to be moved for our last day and we were moved to the former library - a huge room with chandeliers, a fireplace, and a separate sitting area. The staff was very accommodating. The breakfast had so many choices, it would satisfy just about anyone. We would stay there again if we went back to Barcelona. When you go, check out what is going on at the Palau de Musica - it is a magnificent building - one of the most beautiful concert venues I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: The building is lovely, great location minutes away from Plaza Catalunya & centre. The room we had was nothing special but fine for a night. We had a small balcony which was very nice. It must have been a beautiful home in it´s day.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Hotguymike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May 2011. The room was spacious for Europe, and a bargain at $120 Euro a night. Breakfast was included and was well stocked with eggs, ham, cereals, fruit, tea/ coffee, juices, etc. Free wifi and computers were available. View was nothing to write home about, just an ugly courtyard, but I requested that so that we would have quite nights, which it definitely was. The street view rooms are lovely, but louder (in- laws stayed in one). The location is prime- only five minutes walk from Placa Catalunya and bus to the airport. Several metro lines are all very close, so it is simple to get anywhere in the city. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: typographer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Granvia last summer for a week: my cousin came along with us and she booked a single room (one of the reasons we chose the Granvia, as so many hotels do not have single rooms). The first impression was great: a real 19th century Barcelona mansion, the kind of place I'd always wanted to stay in when I was bringing groups of art students to stay in very basic hostals. Staff were extremely helpful: the senior man at reception spoke very good English and all staff there were very happy to order taxis for us and provide information on local restaurants. The room was fine, with a window onto the internal airwell which itself faces onto the roof. We had very little awareness of street noise, despite being on one of the main thoroughfares across the city. The communal lounge was magnificently appointed with chandeliers, paintings and handsome furniture (also internet access provided). This opened onto the roof garden, a large space with a shady loggia for evening drinks. We did not take our breakfasts at the hotel, but only because we were on a budget and it was rather expensive (11 euros?), but the dining room was as elegant as the lounge. We found a great cafe round the corner on Pau Claris, above a bookshop, where we had a buffet breakfast every day in pleasantly bohemian surroundings. The location is difficult to beat: I have visited the city on more than a dozen occasions and really think this was the best area to stay in, only 100 metres from Passeig de Gracia for the posh shops and street cafes, two of Gaudi's greatest works just a few blocks away, Placa Catalunya round the corner and you are also at the centre of the transportation hub. We would return to the Granvia without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfied”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Bettan
Reviews.Content: We had a double room that overlooked the main street. Muffled street noise but not a problem at all. Very happy to have air conditioning as it was hot and muggy outside. Marc was very helpful when we needed to print our boarding passes. Breakfast was included in the price - would not have purchased it otherwise - very good start to the day. All of the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: fedeida Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: superb location a few steps away from almost everything in town, very good staff, reasonably priced. the only weak point is breakfast, which is a bit pricey, but there is plenty of coffe shops nearby. great feeling from its old-fashioned allure: in other words it's more like being hosted by a healty family rather than staying in an hotel. unmissable!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room that had ample space for three. The room had all the amenities we needed. The courtyard was a nice place to relax. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Sarget
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre and post mediteranean cruise from Barcelona. We had been to Barcelona before and knew that most reasonably priced hotels in a good location close to the Las Rambala are either extremely noisy or very basic hostel style. I stumbled across an exceptional deal with Hotels.com.au and we booked 2 double rooms with private bathroom and basic small fridge for my husband and I and my 19yo daughter and her 2 girlfriends. The Hotel is a short distance from Paseig de Gracia metro direct transport from the airport (buy a T10 multitrip if you are there for a few days) and is conveniently located for local supermarket shopping to pick up small goods and breads, alcohol anything you need, as well as walking distance or a couple of metro stops to major attractions such as Las Rambalas or the Magic Fountain. Gran Via has very attentive staff that will advise you on busses and attractions as well as well as a palacial character sitting room and massive outdoor courtyard to enjoy an alfresco lunch of small goods and fresh bread and Cava that you can pick up from a supermarket nearby. Overall for just over $100 per night for a double and $120 for a triple room (without breakfast there are plenty of nearby coffee/pastry shops nearby) this was exceptional value! If you are looking for clean quality 3 star in exceptional location you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for a great bargain - Stay here for sure - especially with kids!”
Reviews.Author: vicg5349
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Granvia for 6 nights and it was absolutely perfect. The hotel is gorgeous as it is an old bourgeoisies palace built in the 1870's. Our room was a family room (2 adults and children ages 9 and 7 years) and it was huge and gorgeous. The staff speaks English well and were very helpful with everything. There is free internet access through a hotel computer and free WiFi in the rooms. The location could not be more perfect. It is 2 blocks from the Placa Catalunya which is the center of town (and tourism office and the Corte Ingles Department/Grocery Store) there is a metro station a half block away (Passeig de Gracia station) and the art nouveau block begins a half block away also (the Passeig de Gracia street). All of the best restaurants we experienced were in this area and could be walked to and it is far enough away from Las Ramblas to avoid any hint of seediness. The hotel has a stunning salon and we paid for breakfast to be included and the breakfast was also great. Each morning a large selection of pastries, chocolate and plain croissants, eggs (scrambled and fried) and chorizo and ham you could slice yourselves. There is a gourmet coffee maker where you put your cup and get delicious coffee. The salon opens to a courtyard that also has some small playground equipment to the side (small slide, seesaw, etc) -- this was a great break for our kids after sightseeing. We have traveled quite a bit and I think it was an incredible deal for a wonderful hotel that I think exceeds the 3 star rating for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, breakfast, service, and reasonable. But, the elder staff is sometimes impolite.”
Reviews.Author: mako7
Reviews.Content: I stayed over 7 nights at this hotel. It was a reasonable hotel. The hotel is located at the central area of the city. And, the breakfast is included in the price and good. The young staffs are kind and supportive. One problem is that an elderly staff is sometimes impolite. For example, when I forgot my room key in the room when checking out, he complained much about it. ( The key was soon found in my room.)

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Romashka3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel. It’s a former 19th century mansion that was some rich family’s residence, and staying at the hotel definitely transported us back in time (in a good way). The common areas are beautiful – antique furniture, paintings, glass cases with books, photos and memorabilia; the décor didn’t feel fake and forced. The room was spacious, clean, adequately furnished (chairs, table, nightstands), the AC worked fine, the wireless internet was fine, the TV was helpful in late evenings, the big window opened to a quite inner court. The bathroom was nice – with daylight and enough counter space, a little stand for toiletries (what a great idea!), with all the usual amenities (hair dryer, toiletry packs). Location was great – short walk to the subway, a Bus Turistico stop, Las Ramblas. We found the younger personnel to be friendlier, very accommodating, speaking good English. The older man we saw at reception desk was a bit brusque. Our reservation included a free breakfast, which we loved: good variety and quality, it seemed like it could please and accommodate just about anybody’s tastes and habits. We used a bottle of water from the minibar that was billed to us at a higher price at the end, but when we mentioned that the price we saw was less, the bill was adjusted in a completely courteous manner, with no conflict whatsoever. Overall, an interesting and a well-run hotel that we would definitely choose to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this spacious grand siecle hotel”
Reviews.Author: etatsunis
Reviews.Content: Our room for three was very spacious. Good air conditioning. Excellent buffet breakfast. Very helpful people at the reception desk. We left some items in the room by mistake when we left but, with several emails from the US, those items were retrived and mailed to us. This is a former banker's home (or palace) from the late eighteenth century. That old fashioned style has been maintained. We loved that. Some many not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware the 'free breakfast' they make you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jtsperansky
Reviews.Content: Great location just a few steps from the metro station. Central to many restaurants, bars and shopping. Easily took the metro to all locations of interest. I had booked a room online which included 'free breakfast' as part of the room rate. However, I was billed 10 euros a day for breakfast. We argued this with the front desk when we checked out, asking how free breakfast can cost 10 euros a day, but he pretended not to understand and after 15 minutes we got frustrated with him and just left. On top of this, the buffet was terrible so we only tried it for only the first morning. However, we were billed for breakfast for all the days we stayed at the hotel. Front desk agent said we have to pay for breakfast everyday whether we eat there or not. How is any of this 'free breakfast'?? Check your bill for added charges like this.

Reviews.Title: “great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tpmp1620
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granvia is built in an old mansion, so not the modern feel you might get elsewhere in Barcelona. The hotel was very standard, but also very centrally located. We were able to walk most places and the few times we needed to take the metro, it was just outside our door. Additionally, the hotel was an easy walk from the airport bus that drops you in Placa Catalunya. We left on a bit of a sour note as we learned on our last day while checking out that breakfast had been included in the price of our room. For obvious reasons, we would have appreciated learning that upon checking in.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mialope
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 daughters and other relatives stayed at the Granvia for 4 nights,the welcoming by Carlos at the front desk was excellent,Carlos was always helpful and made our stay a comfortable and enjoying one,always willing to assit. This hotel is very centrally located,very nice clean rooms,a lovely breakfast room with good selections. Thsi is a well managed establishment with a great staff at all levels,Carlos deserves all the congratulations for his outstanding services,will surely return to Hotel Granvia.

Reviews.Title: “a special hotel”
Reviews.Author: galdaldoc
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at H Granvia and found it to be a great hotel in a terrific location. It is within walking distance of many sites and the metro and bus connections are also close by. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was more than ample. I recommend leaving the main area of Las Ramblas and investigating some of the side streets. There we attended a guitar concert in a church, saw Roman ruins and stopped at an art fair in a small plaza. Check out the jazz at Casa Fuster; the food there was exceptionally good. The park near the Picasso Museum is lovely and the zoo within the park is very modern with a wide variety of animals. There are great chocolate & pastry shops in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Faded gem”
Reviews.Author: williedillo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location and the offer of free breakfast if you stay more than two nights. The public spaces of the hotel are just as attractive as the web site suggests. You have your breakfast (which is very good) under huge crystal chandeliers and the hotel has a very attractive terrace out back for drinks in the afternoon or evening. But, the room was below that standard. Based on the recommendation of a popular guidebook, we requested an interior room to avoid street noise. That was not a wise choice--the room was small, musty, and drab. Unfortunately, we could not move to anything better as the hotel was full. If we go there again, we'll ask for a back room facing the terrace--got a glimpse of one when it was open for cleaning and it looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,fantastic location,breakfast galore”
Reviews.Author: benearme8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granvia is a great choice ! Front desk are very helpful with directions, booking tours and greets you. Our room is spacious and quiet overlooking the courtyard. Bed is comfortable, bathroom is very clean. This hotel is in a great location. Very accesible on buses from airport and back. Closeby to La Ramblas, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery, department stores. Breakfast here is amazing plus the breakfast room is beautiful as well as their living room and courtyard. The only problem we experienced is the wifi in our room is not always working, especially at night when you wanted to check your email before bed. We hope they can put a better wifi service next time. But other than that, this hotel is great and we will stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: basaffi
Reviews.Content: we were a family of three adults, stayed here one night. this was a great, small, unique hotel. we stayed here one night after a cruise and found it to be very comfortable. we arrived early and they had a salon where we could wait until our room was ready. we used it for a short time and then decided to leave our luggage with the front desk while we explored the many things close buy. it was more of a business area than previous areas we had stayed in, but was very near Las Ramblas and easy to reach other areas of the city. Our room was ready much earlier than they had thought, the front desk took our luggage to our room while we were out exploring. the room was a little small for three, but we were able to get by without any problems. we did not eat breakfast there because we headed early to the airport which is about twenty minutes away. we enjoyed walking around the neighborhood and we very much enjoyed the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: sophiatravels
Reviews.Content: Its a lovely older hotel: Very clean, safe in the room, modern bathrooms, a courtyard and great deal on breakfast. The staff are very nice. The Granvia is perfectly positioned for access to the metro and the train station for the airport. The Granvia is just a few blocks away from Las Ramblas, The Casa Milà, the Barri Gothic district (walked to the music center to hear classical Spanish guitar, church on Sunday too). We walked to most everything or hopped on the metro (its awesome). I had to say it was a tiny bit noisy as we could hear the neighbors a bit and some renovations during the day but everyone was generally quiet, except the birds in the courtyard (but i liked them, my partner , not so much) We has a great time in Barcelona and the Granvia was a good part of that, thank you! Jane and Steve

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: jockeygirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are more like a suite than a hotel room. The hotel is quite grand and it is run very professionally. Breakfast all you could ask for, good fridge, storage and bathroom. We were not sure whether we asked however we were accommadated at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet. Great value in a great city, our only fault is that we underestimated Barcelona and intend returning next October and will definetly stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: MTM45
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful and helpful. Location is central and perfect for exploring by foot or public transport. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Keen_traveller079
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased we chose the Hotel Granvia. Having never been to Barcelona and chosen this because of its low price on the internet, we arrived with a little trepidation but were really impressed. It's not a luxury choice, but it's great value for money and its location is excellent. If you're after somewhere where you can get a night's sleep and some decent breakast in a central location, I'd recommend this. The reception staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The room we stayed in was basic - which was fine for what we were after and frankly much nicer than most you would get at this price. The TV reception wasn't good, but that didn't bother us because we didn't spend much time in there so we didn't mention it to the staff. And impressive as the communal areas - reception and hallways - still are, it does feel as though it's lost a little of its grandeur. Location is the biggest selling point. It's only a short walk to Placa Catalunya, the Ramblas, Gaudi's Casa Battlo, and bus and metro stops are a stone's throw away. You can easily walk to the Gothic Quarter in 15 minutes. If you're after luxury and have got the cash to pay for it, stay elsewhere. If you want great value, brilliant location and a warm welcome. go for the Granvia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: watermelontravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel Granvia was a very pleasant place to stay. It is very convientently located off the Aerobus route from the airport. The staff was pleasant and helpful with recommendations. The rooms were very clean and comfy. We had a room right on the street and while there was some street noise, it did not bother us. The hotel has a charming courtyard where we took our morning coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in an "interior" room”
Reviews.Author: bac48
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel which is well situated in the city. We were given an "interior" room - away from road noise!! I would have settled for road noise, instead we got echoed noise of cleaning staff from quite early in the mornings. Room was quite small but bed comfortable. Bathroom tiny but lots of hot water. Front reception staff were always helpful with suggestions and tips on what to see and the best way to get there. The breakfasts were quite good in a lovely room . We used the garden area and the salon (free wi fi). The elevator was broken on one of our days there and walking up 3 flights of stairs was not what we wanted after a day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: marwan1975
Reviews.Content: me and my friends spent 5 nights in hotel granvia ,2 weeks before.. location is really perfect, one block from passiege de gracia, 3 minutes walk to placa catalunia and 6 minutes to la rambla. public areas in the hotel are really magnificent, old and charming.. front desk people were nice, tried their best to help , but couldn,t help me at all to get tickets for barca football match against arsenal..which i managed by myself our courtyard facing twin room was small , clean (except heavy dust covering the old tv ), decent minibar ,safe and very comfortable beds. the free wi fi was a good bonus breakfast room was charming and nice, breakfast itself was excellent ..plenty and fresh. overall ..if you are looking for a decent 3 stars hotel in the very heart of barcelona.. and with 100 euoros per night.. hotel granvia is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cazziebeebee
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here in March. Hotel location was excellent. Close to the Ramblas and the bus drops offs at Catalunya Square. Twin room was spacious and clean, but was at front of hotel so lot of traffic noise. Breakfast was very good and the staff always courteous. One problem was the very thin walls you could hear everything from the next room - TV, talking, etc, and while we were there, we were up til about 3am listening to the general chit chat of a load of America girls who seemed to have congregated in the room next to ours. The weather was really awful with heavy rain. On the morning we checked out, we got caught out in the rain and soaked through to the skin. The hotel staff were very helpful and let us use one the smaller rooms to dry off and change before heading off again to the airport. We thought this was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Getting on a bit, but never fails to please”
Reviews.Author: alexmac
Reviews.Content: Back to Granvia for the umpteenth time and its as great as ever; how does this place survive in the 21st Century. Great, elegant spacious communal areas with the same traditional faded grandeur, wonderful baroque chandeliered and mirrored breakfast room (with a very generous buffet presentation with the highest quality ingredients including brandy for your coffee if you´ve had a hard night!); and the same charming, efficient and helpful staff. If you don´t mind the hum of traffic noise ask for a high ceilinged room at the front- number 103 is good in that it has a rare balcony). And with Plaza Cataluña only 2 minutes walk away, the hotel is perfectly located to explore thge whole of Barcelona by foot. Notthe cheapest at around 100 Euros a night, but great value for a short break

Reviews.Title: “Charming stay in a charming building with an outstandingly charming staff!!”
Reviews.Author: ruthie99
Reviews.Content: The bulding is charming beyond words, in a safe and central area....the bedrooms are smaller and plain but with comfortable beds and very clean. Bathrooms are great... An older mansion converted into a smaller hotel (only 52 rooms). The salon and dining areas are just beautiful..... The staff was consistently and genuinely the politest and most helpful of any hotel I've stayed in from Asun Pajera (manager), the gentlemen at the front desk (Juan, Carlos , Ricard, Manuel and Xaviar) to the ladies who cleaned the rooms and served breakfast. We had a personal emergency at one point and the staff went out of their way to assist us...... When we checked in we were greeted by Carlos with "this is your home, allow us to help you in anyway that we can..." and that is exactly what happened.. Thanks Hotel Gran Via for a great three weeks! thanks to Rick Steves for an excellent recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: DEN2551
Reviews.Content: stayed at the grandvia jan13-15 and 18-30. arrived in the morning, room was ready great after an all night trans atlantic flight. this place is a gem, close to everything, great sfaff always helpful, especially richard and juan. would and will recommend the grandvia to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location in exciting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4248
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in Hotel Granvia in late November and early December. The staff was very helpful, especially Xavier, Juan and Mark. Checkin was very quick. Both of our rooms were spacious and very comfortable and quiet, as they faced the back patio. The beds were a little hard for us. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The breakfast was extensive and delicious and worth the price. The location is superb, out of the conjestion of the Old Quarter, 2 blocks from Placa Catalunya and on major bus routes. The Passeig de Gracia train station was also very close. Restaurants abound in the area. The Modernista art trail is within walking distance or for Sagrada Familia an easy subway or for Park Guell an easy bus ride. The staff was also happy to keep one of our bags, while we were in other cities in Spain. One could not ask for a better hotel in a better location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff, pleasant atmosphere, great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: LindaYCarlos
Reviews.Content: It was an easy walk from Placa De Catalunya where the Aerobus terminated. Good location for catching the sightseeing bus which takes you everywhere you want to visit as a tourist. Hotel staff was very helpful in giving us instructions to find the train that would take us to the Sants train station. Breakfast was served in a very elegant setting and the salon room was also impressive. The room was comfortable enough and we enjoyed our stay, in spite of several days of rain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel conveniently located in heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rahmani1000
Reviews.Content: Overall very nice hotel, excellent location, clean rooms but fairly expensive breakfast. It is highly recommended! we were very happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “gret location.great value”
Reviews.Author: croge
Reviews.Content: just returned from hotel granvia,arrived thurs evening,cab straight from airport,27 euro,good reception staff very helpful.Rooms fine two large single beds enough wardrobe space,bathroom very clean.lovely little courtyard for coffee.Hotel just around the corner to las rambles,bus stop outside no 56 bus straight to football stadium,lots of restaurants,bars within area.Asked reception staff directions etc,always happy to oblige.Have had a wonderfull three days break at a very good price,fitted in so much because of central location,and to top it all weather 22 degrees!Booked with expedia,flew easyjet and no complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Good value-Great location”
Reviews.Author: brickwall26
Reviews.Content: Well situated,just north of Las Ramblas.Reasonably priced,very clean.front desk helpful and friendly,nice breakfast available,the rooms are small but more than adequate for our needs,would definitely stay there if we were to return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & well-situated”
Reviews.Author: m0neymaven45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 3 separate occasions - twice with spouse, once alone. Most convenient to airport bus at Plaza Catalunya, a good 3-block walk, close to restaurants, shops, and Las Ramblas. On the 2nd reservation, we arrived to find it was cancelled due to a credit card change since making the reservation. The desk clerk arranged a taxi (paid by the hotel) to another more upscale hotel at the same rate for the night, then made sure we had a room on our return the next night. Although the other hotel was modern and luxurious, I preferred the ambiance of Hotel Granvia and its particular character. Our room was comfortable, a/c worked fine, we found staff courteous and accommodating. In the summer, the interior rooms are cooler than the ones facing the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VacationOslo
Reviews.Content: Great location near Aerobus and Placa Cataluna. A bit worn hotel, but nice staff. The room had

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Quality”
Reviews.Author: CharlieVVancouver
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Barcelona was met with a great deal of research. I was looking for a hotel that matched the historic area. I selected the Hotel Granvia. The picture of the room on their website was exactly as the room appeared. An email was sent a few days ahead to confirm my reservation. I arrived tired. The checkin was short with a great assist in bringing the bags to our room. The staff answered all my questions concerning directions. They even allowed our bags to remain after checkout while we toured the Barri Gotic area prior to our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: BonAppetit09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two times - at the beginning and end of our cruise. We were so lucky that they let us check in very early after our cruise. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and clean. There is a charming courtyard, where we sat after a long day of sightseeing. The location was ideal - not only walking distance of many sights, but there was a Metro station right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: strongy39
Reviews.Content: Woulld definately recommend this hotel, good value for a lovely hotel. Reception staff above and beyond good. Rooms very clean and bed very comfy. Have stayed in other central Barcelona hotels which were not a patch on this one. Location is spot on, metro and bus stop just outside and within 5 mins walk to placa catalunya and the ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked- they made us move to a different hotel, nowhere near the Granvia.”
Reviews.Author: Dori020
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Granvia to spend 2 nights in Barcelona for our honeymoon. When we checked in, we were rudely informed that there were no rooms left - despite having made our reservations 3 months before. They moved us to a hotel that they assured us was very close. It was not. It took 10 minutes to drive to the new hotel, which was very nice but not anywhere near where we intended to be! No apologies were ever offered- in fact, the man was clearly annoyed with us and the entire situation. He was beyond rude. When we got to the 2nd hotel, we had to switch to a non-smoking room since Granvia didn't provide our reservation information. Took about 2 hours of our time, total. They then told us we could stay at eithe rhotel for the next night. Since we only had 2 nights in Barcelona, we decided to just stay at the 2nd hotel, only to be told at the front desk that Hotel Granvia was wrong and we had to get out. It took nearly 10 minutes for the situation to be resolved, during which time they mentioned that we had booked on Expedia and that was why we were the people who were bumped. Clearly, we were considered 2nd rate travelers for paying a discount room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the character and location! Only thing missing was helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: ashporta
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, our room, beds & bath, spacious, character, location, clean, really unique and fun to stay at! The front desk staff just seemed annoyed, each member of our party asked a question or two during the stay and all came to the same conclusion that maybe these people should not work in customer service, they just seemed annoyed all the time to be working in a hotel and were not very helpful or concerned with helping guests. This hotel would be perfect if they hired one happy staff person per shift :) Would still stay here again because we got our questions answered by friendly locals :)

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here agin if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: bianca984
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a full day of travelling and arriving late at night all we wanted was a clean room and a shower. The room smelt terrible of fresh cigarette smoke then I went to have a shower and the shower didn't work. I spoke to reception and they said it will be fixed asap. The next afternoon only after heading down to reception again to do alittle more complaining did something happen. The only good thing about this hotel is the free internet access but i wouldn't risk your clothes smelling of ciggie smoke for that! Pretty sure the maintenance men or the room cleaners have no problems with smoking in your room.

Reviews.Title: “central hotel located within walking distance from La Rambla the city Hub excellent value”
Reviews.Author: culturvore
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel with large salon and outdoor patio and free internet! Great value bed only. Breakfast not required as there is a fantastic supermarket in La Rambla with excellent prices. Reception staff extremely helpful. Room very clean with large open-out pension- styled windows which were wonderful to open to get the early morning sunshine while having your own breakfast from the fridge in the room.Alternatively sit out on the patio.The hotel only has three floors and was very quiet and peaceful during our stay. The location could'nt be better placed /right beside the metro, on the bus route/ and a 10 minute bus ride no 45 from around the corner to the right for the beautifully breathtaking beach with plenty of restaurants here. Generally the food is of a high reasonably priced quality with lots of varied cultural restaurants within the city.Mind your belongings wherever you are in Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great service, good facilities.”
Reviews.Author: gavolos
Reviews.Content: All about this hotel is location. Situated at the center of Barcelona, one block away from Placa Catalunya, the hotel offers instant access to public transport and all nearby major sights and a lot of good restaurants and tapas bars. The reception was very warm and helpful. We had booked a triple room (for us and our young daughter). When we arrived, we were informed that our room was not available (due to plumbing problems) and we were offered a double plus a single rooms with no extra charge. That was very honest of them.The rooms were spacey, clean, however their decoration is a little outdated. The hotel occupies a 19th century building with a fabulous hotel entrance, staircase and a first floor where the lounge and the breakfast room are situated. Overall a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, cramped, and rude, despite location and history”
Reviews.Author: citybythelake
Reviews.Content: The hotel's public amenities are beautifully appointed, and it's obvious it's filled with history. It's also in a good location, close to Plaza Catalunya, on the Gran Via, and a block from Passeig de Gracia. However, the desk staff were rude and our room was subpar. We had to share a double bed, the bathtub was mini, and the AC barely worked. The first night there was a wedding party going on in the courtyard below, and afterwards the revelers moved into the room next to ours, staying up all night partying and smoking. We had noise and cigarette smoke wafting into our room all night because we had the window open due to the AC not working well. They offered free, in-room wi-fi, but it only worked sporadically. Overall, a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “I like it!)))”
Reviews.Author: Stranger-girl
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone! In July 2010 my husband and I had a few unforgettable days in Barselone.We stay at Hotel Gran Via. This is a 3 Star hotel, so to the minor problems, such as 2 days idle elevator, we did not pay attention! The main thing for us was the magnificent location of the hotel! In general, we liked the hotel!))) Firstly - beautiful architectural building of the hotel, in the second -responsive staff, and third, although a small but very nice and comfortable hotel room-with Gran Via st. view. I also have advice for future guests the hotel-if you do not like something and so on..., contact the reception area and they will help! To all friends I certainly advise to stay at the hotel, when they will visit Barcelona!!!)))

Reviews.Title: “Good value, bad service”
Reviews.Author: fixOslo
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a one-night stay on our way home. Family-room booked in advance over the net. The room was ok, clean with four beds, two folded down from the wall. The air-conditioning was not working. The room had windows to the Grand Via, and there is a lot of noice. The hotel has a lovely and special interior, it is a pleasure to walk the stairs and sit in the outdoor terrasse. The location is also good, close to both the old-town and the Ramblas. My main objection is the service. The man at the front desk was incredibly rude, inattentive and tried to make us pay for one more night, refusing to look at the reservation confirmation I had printed out before we left home. He was devaluating and made us very angry. He was also on call when we arrived, making us wait for 10 minutes while he arranged some papers behind the desk. I have stayed at the GrandVia Hotel before, and liked it very much. This time the stay was a dissapointment, and I will chose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: scienceteech
Reviews.Content: We arrived at El Prat early on a Thursday and also easily found the Aerobus to take us to Plaza Catalunya. It was an easy 2 block walk from the drop off spot to Hotel Granvia, even with luggage. We were greeted nicely and smoothly checked in. We were given information on the Barcelona Hop On Hop Off bus but it wasn pushed on us and we were not interested. We had reserved the family room for the four of us and it worked out well although only due to the large sitting and luggage-closet area and large and well-appointed bathroom, not due to the sleeping arrangements. Two very small double beds (kind of like 1.5 twin beds) were pushed side by side for the four of us. It was tight but we managed. The very large shower bath and sink area made up for it. This was a great location for walking to almost any place in Barcelona, and made even better with one of the Passeig de Gracia metro stops right outside the hotel door (and the Catalunya stops only ly due to the large sitting and luggage-closet area and large and well-appointed bathroom, not due to the sleeping arrangements.
