Two very small double beds (kind of like 1.5 twin beds) were pushed side by side for the four of us. It was tight but we managed. The very large shower bath and sink area made up for it. This was a great location for walking to almost any place in Barcelona, and made even better with one of the Passeig de Gracia metro stops right outside the hotel door, and the Catalunya stops only 2 blocks away. We had asked for a quiet room when reserving and were given one on an interior courtyard that was definitely quiet. We ate dinner 3 nights at the cafes on Rambla de Catalunya, a very easy walk from Hotel Granvia. This was not our favorite hotel of our trip to Spain but it was a very good way to start. The building has charm, the hotel staff was very competent and easily agreed to store our luggage 'for as long as we want' on our last day in Barcelona, and we felt we got good value for a large city hotel (we did not take the breakfast ).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: DKVogel0810
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Barcelona Airport and were sure we were going to take the Aerobus outside the T1 terminal (arrived Delta). Took the Aerobus to Catalunya - had some communication issues on the bus and weren't really sure where to get off. We figured it out!! Once off the bus at Catalunya we weren't sure which direction to go in. Well...get off the bus walk forward 2 streets and take a Right. Past the Corte de Inglis department store (by the way it has a grocery store on the bottom floor - buy water here it is cheap). The hotel is clean and simple. We had no problems. We were able to book tours at the hotel front desk. We did the wine cava tour and it was well worth the money. We did Monserrat on our own and should have done the tour. They did ask for our key when we left and kept it for us while we were out. No chance to loose it this way. There is a restaurant a few doors down with good beer. Also, go left out of the hotel to the end of the street and go right. There is a restaurant called Divinius which is very good. Also - Farggi (right around the corner) has fabulous desserts and coffee. If you leave the hotel and go right go to the end of the street and turn right - go two blocks and there is a starbucks. Most things are close and you can catch the hop on hop off at Catalunya as well. We also purchased our tickets for this at the front desk. They were very very helpful. The elevator at this hotel only holds 3 people at a time - so note this. A few drawbacks....towels are not soft and nice (a little rough) room is bare and not homey. This is a very standard european room. If you do get a room facing the front of the hotel it will be noisy - make no mistake. This didn't bother me - but it would most if not used to it. If you are looking for a clean, resonable and overall great location for a european hotel - then book this one. Do not book it if you are looking for a modern, amenitie filled cushy US type chain hotel. I would most certainly stay here again if I visited Barcelona. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madeingermany
Reviews.Content: First you can't beat the location of this hotel. On the Gran Via in the middle of everything. A short walk to the Las Ramblas, and the Port, and walkable to everywhere else Segrada Familia, Picasso Museum, etc. This old mansion converted to a lovely hotel that is absolutely gorgeous and a surprise. Breakfast was great and worth the money and the breakfast room is pretty awsome. Our room was a surprise. We booked a double and a single (for our friend). Our double was very big and with a balcony. The single was very sufficient but more importantly they were both very clean. We coudn't be happier with this hotel and feel we lucked out on this one, Barcelona hotels can be very expensive and this was worth every EURO.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a splendid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jacquidougliss
Reviews.Content: What a surprise, I knew the location was good but the hotel was a real shock it is lovely the staff are helpful even with our volcanic ash problem they did everything possible to make our stay perfect. We would of liked a bar or some mini wines in the mini bar just to have whie getting ready for the evening and the use of an iron would of been great but in the scale of things this hotel was a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old elegant Hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Ursula021
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, right in the heart of Barcelona. Steps from the Passeig de Gracia and Catalunya Plaza. The hotel is on The Gran via Cort...the heart of the city. Subway, airport bus, and tour bus are within 2 blocks... plus great restaurants. Older couple, we were very happy with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aspasia79
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Barcelona seem to be a little expensive but with Granvia you can get a bargain. If you need a relatively cheap and clean place to sleep after all day walking and indulging in Barcelona's life, Granvia is for you. The building itself is used to be a state house I think, it has beautiful features. Two floors elegance I would say. The leading staircase is spectacular. Unfortunately the rooms are not on those two floors...after the main entrance you expect the same beauty in your room but that's not what you get. But still nice rooms. Not the biggest rooms, but comfortable. Our room had windows to the back not to the street so it was quiet. We had view of other buildings. The room was really warm, I don't know how could it be as the heating wasn't on, the sun didn't shine (we had snowy weather in March!) The service in the hotel was satisfying. There was free internet in the room, it was fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, shame about the shabby room”
Reviews.Author: DJ-Travellers
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the hotel location. Hotel lobby is nice and the Salon was so European and we really thought we would be in for a treat...until we saw our room. The bedspread was very shabby and a chair in the corner of the room was filthy we didn't dare touch it! Had a nice balcony overlooking a nice courtyard. Shame about the full ashtray on the balcony from the previous night.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dilvink
Reviews.Content: comfortable, clean, located at the city centre, 100 mt to metro station and placa catalonia...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TnsTrvlr
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at this hotel at the beginning of November. We would like to acknowledge Carlos (evening desk) and Juan (day manager) for their extraordinary assistance in making our stay very, very pleasant. Carlos was very helpful in answering all of our questions about Spain and Catalonia, he also tried very hard to help me with my camera adapter (having inadvertently left my adapter in the US). Juan does take a little getting used to, but was extremely helpful in helping me save many euros by telling me the discounts offered by bus turista. The location is superb, within walking distance of Placa Catelunya (heart of Barcelona) and some of Gaudi's buildings. The Hotel is like a grand old dame who is showing her age. The common areas, such as the salon and the terrace, are elegant, but the room furnishings and the bathrooms could be improved. Coffee makers in the rooms would be appreciated. We did get a special rate for staying more than three nights, and given the weakness of the US dollar, that made the hotel a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Quiet; Central Location”
Reviews.Author: skkc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Granvia for 3 days after completing a Medit. Cruise. The hotel is lovely, the front desk gentlemen are friendly and helpful, and the hotel has free internet service (only 2 PCs, so there can be a wait). The bedroom is very basic and rather dreary, but the bathroom is clean and spacious. I really appreciated the peace and quiet in the room; I slept all night and even took an afternoon nap, uninterrupted by street noise or hallway traffic. The location is in city central, close to the metro, hop on/hop off bus, shopping district, restaurants, Las Ramblas - a GREAT location! I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Abjee
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the right location for tourists with the subway, tourist and airport bus hub 5 minutes away. The eating places and interesting old city areas are within walking distance. There is no room service in the hotel and reception though understaffed provides basic level of services. The buffet breakfast was good and the room rent reasonable. It would be very useful if they provide electric kettle and tea/coffee in the rooms. I like to drink a lot of tea and had to buy tea bags and dipped them in warm water from the taps in a glass. It was far from satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to everybody travelling to Barcelona. A few minutes walk from everything, really nice rooms and good service ..... and a very competitive price. We'll definately stay there again if/when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable expectations make for a fine visit”
Reviews.Author: beachmama94
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Hotel Granvia is the location for transportation--one block from the Passeig de Gracia subway station, two blocks from the Placa de Catalunya subway (and the Barcelona Turiste tour bus), and 3 blocks from the station where you get trains to other locations in Spain. It is a short walk to the Rambla, the Berri Gotic (old town) and the waterfront. The location more than met our expectations and allowed us access to most of the sights. Using the "hop on, hop off" Barcelona Touriste bus on the first day of your stay will give you a great overview of the city and allow you to "hop on and hop off" at sites that are of interest of you. Money (21 Euros) very well spent as you can spend the whole day (or 2 days for a few more Euros) touring the city this way. (with good narration about the sites). Expectations you bring about what a hotel should be will color your stay at Granvia. If you expect the kinds of amenities that are found in most American hotels (an abundance of big, thirsty towels, robes, double sinks, tons of toiletries, thick comforters, king size beds, a sitting area and a bed covered in throw pillows, and a flat screen t.v. and large lobbies) you will be disappointed in the Granvia. You might not want to stay there. But if you want a certain old world charm of a former 1800's former mansion--polished wood floors, beautiful wood paneling, a sweeping marble staircase, a Spanish courtyard with tile and columns, palm trees and places to sit--and a clean room with few pretentions, this is the place to stay. We were able to stay 6 nights at a special rate which didn't break us financially given the exchange rate at this time. Since we spent so little time in the room it really didn't matter if we had thick, plush towels and the other things. Instead, we were made to think about the excesses we sometimes have come to expect in hotels in the US and how simpler really IS better for everyone. We didn't NEED all the bells and whistles. We had a wonderful time exploring the city and visiting with our son who is studying abroad in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to it's website description”
Reviews.Author: Zoe005
Reviews.Content: Didn't get off to a great start as we were asked unfriendly desk clerk to "please wait 5 minutes" before we could check in. The first room we were given was tiny and gloomy and the small double bed was rock hard. We asked for another room and were moved to a twin. Beds were not much better, furnishings should have been replaced years ago. Our room was not "soundproof" as advertised, as it had the old style windows which don't keep out noise. On our 4th night a film crew moved in to make a movie and took over the whole hotel keeping us awake all night until 6 am when they left. While they were there we weren't allowed to access the lounge area, the computers or the terrace. (we were offered a discount for that night). It was also advertised that there were two English channels on the TV but this was not the case, there was nothing in English not even CNN! We got sick of handing in our key every time we left the hotel, and then having to wait around to get it back, so in the end we just kept it with us. Also it was ludicrous that we had to pay 2.50 euros per day to use the safe. About the only good thing about the hotel was its location but beware of the parking station next to the hotel - it cost us 35 euros to park our hire car overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pippin23
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, excellent desk staff, particularly the daytime guy that's been there for 34 years. He is fantastic. Rooms spare but quiet (if you are at the back). Can't say enough about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: XROTHERHAMX
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better - quiet street but only short walk to main square, Ramblas and central loactions. Our room had limited natural light but loads of character. I sent an e asking if there were hair dryers provided (there were) but did not get a reply. Loads of bars and restaurents very close. Best to check price of drinks before ordering, where ever you go, as they seem to make up prices. Prices for drinks varied widely from similar establishments. Two day toursit bus rover ticket is better value than for one day and can be used to hop on and off at many loactions. Three computors in hotel with free internet access. Breakfast has lots of choice, is in a nice big uncrowded room and is good quality food. Has hot plate of bacon/sausage etc.. Hotel price did not include breakfast but I thought it did - bets check this as breakfast is a whopping 11 euros each. I would recommend this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Greate Location - Just OK Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: wutdhec
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to all the good stuff. Room is outdated and very spartan; same could be said for the hotel. But, at about 100 euros, it was a good value. Highly recommend having breakfast at Navarro's around the corner and down the street toward the Plaza Catalunya. I don't care much for the whole business of letting them hold on to your key when you leave the room, but I guess thats common in Europe. The safe deposit box was extra charge of 2.50 eu per day...kind of silly. The minibar prices are really reasonable. Beds were a little tired, but I slept OK...location was quiet for me (room towards the back). Stay here to save some money and be in an acceptable if plain room in a great location. Don't stay here if you want to feel like you're in luxurious place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Renata_23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very good location! You are close to the main square, La Ramblas and the stops for the "hop-on-hop-off" buses. I was not pleased with the hotel for the price that I have paid for. The internet is free but I was not able to get it on the 3rd floor. We tried to put our belongings into the safety deposit box, but the reception had no key for it. Also, the TV has a horrible reception and there was no English channels. I got fed up and asked to be moved somewhere else. After one night, I moved to the 1st floor. The internet was working, TV had a better reception and I got the key for the deposit box (for two days, I had to pay 5 Euro extra in cash). If I would come to Barcelona again, I would not stay at this hotel. The bed is horrible and for the 3 nights that I have spent in this hotel, I did not sleep well at all. I guess, I am use to the Western style hotel and this one would not get the 3 star hotel from me. If you do not care where you going to sleep but the location is important to you, then this is the hotel for you. Otherwise, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable, grand decor, nearby parking”
Reviews.Author: Samella
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly as it says on its website. Perfectly located for Plaza Catalunya, and the heart of the city. As we needed parking for our rental car, this suited the bill as it meant we didn't need to navigate the streets of Barcelona, as there is a parking building alongside it, and as it was on the main road off the motorway from the south, it was easy to find. The decor of the salon was amazing and there was free internet access, as well as an outdoor terrace. We had a triple and two doubles - the only issue is that the triple had one fold out bed added but it was still comfortable enough. The rooms were clean and the bathroom clean with hairdryer, plenty of towels etc. Would definitely recommend for an affordable, centrally located hotel, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful elegant hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: marybbloom
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed Granvia Hotel. The room was nice and elegant also the staff was helpful and friendly. Price was reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, ideal for us!”
Reviews.Author: Bobadoba
Reviews.Content: First of all, after reading some reviews regarding items being stolen, Barcelona is renowned for petty crime and I know scores of people who have had items stolen. But having visited this beautiful city around 5 times, this time for 10 nights, I can quite honestly say I have had absolutely no trouble at all. While I completely sympathise with people who do have items stolen and who have been mugged, you really do have to make sure that valuables are kept in the safe at all times or on your person, as I have heard of break ins and robberies at so many Barcelona hotels, not just this one. Hotel Granvia was incredibly easy to find having taken the Aerobus in complete darkness. It's a fairly small hotel and the reception is helpful, if not over-welcoming and friendly. The services offered by the hotel stop at dry cleaning and an expensive breakfast buffet (11 Euro, make sure you go early before much of the food is gone otherwise it really isn't worth this cost!), but we noticed that the staff do their best to make what they offer as good as possible. My boyfriend was disappointed that the breakfast buffet was out of Serrano ham one morning, so mentioned this to the staff member on duty who immediately cut him around 10 more slices! Also, we requested a double room with a terrace although we didn't know whether or not this would be possible, and after the first night in a twin room due to limited availability were upgraded to a large room with a terrace and double bed which was wonderful. The TV didn't work, but we weren't on holiday to watch TV and didn't mention this to the staff, so couldn't say whether or not it would have been mended. The interior of the building is fairly grand and some of the larger rooms used for meetings and breakfast are beautifully decorated. The courtyard is lovely and well maintained, and the hotel is cleaned immaculately every day. Our room was always spotless and very tidy when we returned from a day out. I would agree with some previously reviewers about some elements being dated, for example the display cases full of Barcelona souvenirs and guide books from 1994 are not so great! The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. It's a short walk from the Placa de Catalunya and the top of Las Ramblas, and the Passeig de Gracia metro stop is less than 100 metres from the hotel. This is one of the main stops in Barcelona, and almost everywhere you want to visit in the city is within 4 metro stops (direct) from this stop. You can also connect to the Passeig de Gracie Renfe (train) station from this stop, from which you can travel to places like Sitges for the seaside, Port Aventura for the theme park and Barcelona airport. To walk to the beach from the hotel takes around 20 minutes or 10 using the metro, and a taxi from somewhere like Port Olympic to the hotel costs around 10 Euro. Choose this hotel if you are happy not to have a restaurant, spa, pool etc on site, but instead a comfortable bed, clean room and brilliant location. Try eating somewhere like the highly recommended Txapela tapas bar near the Placa de Catalunya (but be prepared to queue in the evenings!) and buy bocadillos (Calamari with hot mayonnaise was a firm favourite, for only around 3 Euros) and tapas from the excellent bar next door to the hotel . Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our bag was stolen in the breakfast restaurant, staff and management did not care!!!”
Reviews.Author: CondorCaruso
Reviews.Content: Our bag of great value was stolen in Granvia's breakfast restaurant - the thieves could enter and leave the hotel without notice of staff - no staff in the restaurant during the theft. Management took afterwards no responsibility of the restaurant. GO ONLY HERE IF YOU CAN DON'T CARE ABOUT YOUR THINGS.

Reviews.Title: “Granvia Hotel - decadent lobby ,big stair cases, with grand reception rooms”
Reviews.Author: ClarelLeeds_UK
Reviews.Content: Located 5 minutes from Place de Catalunya the Granvia hotel provides very comfortable and spacious accommodation. From the street the hotel doesn't look particularly promising but inside you get a very pleasant surprise. Originally built as a palace for a Spanish noble family the hotel boasts a very decadent lobby ,big stair cases, with grand reception rooms in which you can relax and eat breakfast. The bedrooms are very comfortable, very clean and of a good size and quiet!. The hotel doesn't have a bar but each room has a very reasonably priced mini bar, and you can take your drinks into the large enclosed court yard. Break fast is good with excellent coffee. The staff are friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again. Tip- make sure you don't get confused with the Gravia Hotel also in Barcelona, we did and turned up at the worng hotel to start with.

Reviews.Title: “An undiscovered gem of a hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Vagabond
Reviews.Content: After staying one night at a much pricier hotel which was noisy and well worn we went looking for a quieter hotel still near major attractions and found Hotel Granvia. This little gem of a hotel was sparkling clean, superbly friendly and most convenient. Very charming old mansion of a place but updated to all the modern conveniences. Our room faced the back terraza with plants and tables where we stopped at the end of each day to open our bottle of wine and rest our tired feet. Breakfast at 11 Euro per person was actually a great value because it included a wide assortment of meats, breads, eggs, fruit, juices, coffee, etc. We enjoyed 3 nights here and wish we had found this our first night. Just one block away from El Corter Ingles, the best department store/grocery store in Spain. Two blocks from the top of Las Ramblas and one block from all the tour bus stops, metro, etc. Really a great value. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful and fluent in all languages.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the terrace and great location near the airport bus, train/metro and the sightseeing bus”
Reviews.Author: SOLAColorado
Reviews.Content: A good value for Barcelona. The terrace was perfect for relaxing. WiFi throughout. They offer two computers for guest use. Breakfast is a full buffet with unlimited coffee. I had a very comfortable, clean room for one person. The hotel staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SionHill
Reviews.Content: A party of 3 of us have returned from Barcelona and stayed at Hotel Granvia 642, 08007, Barcelona and have had a wonderful stay. Talk of location - just off Catalyna Square and 2 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. I would highly recommend this hotel.Our room was spotless and we asked for a quiet room which we got even on one morning the rooms was so quiet we overslept. The staff were wonderful and so nice and helpful. Free internet access in an amazing sitting room. Fantastic character in this wonderful hotel. Breakfast at E 11 was well worth it with really lovely fresh fruit, breads ect. We are looking forward already to our next visit and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with a touch of grandeur from a different age....”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyperson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the Passeig de Gracia end of the Gran Via and so you can easily walk to the Ramblas. It is a lovely old 19th century building, probably originally a merchant's mansion. So if you like modern clean lines in a hotel, this is probably not for you. But the rooms are large, beds are comfortable, the bathroom has everything you need (altough a few more toiletries would have been welcome, but that is only a small point). We could hear the traffic noise from the street below but it didn't prevent us from sleeping; there was no noise from corridors or other rooms. We didn't eat breakfast there, as there was an extra charge for it and not being lovers of big breakfasts, we preferred to grab a coffee and a cake in near by cafe. As we had arrived in Barcelona on a busy weekend with no hotel booking, and having tried other hotels in the area only to be told that they were full, we were probably lucky to get this hotel for 107 Euro per night. You could probably get it cheaper with an advance booking. But anyway, Barcelona is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: BPfromTO
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the comments regarding traffic noise , I requested for a quiet room, facing the courtyard. The room was nice and comfy and not a stir was detacted during my 7 days stay. The full hot breakfast , which was included was good and plentiful. The day time staff , Juan, was the most helpful person in town. He speaks excellent English! I certainly will come back to Barcelona, and I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: AucklandNZTravellers
Reviews.Content: This place was lovely for our 3 night stay in early October. It was quiet at nights, and located about 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and 5 minutes walk to the Hop-On - Hop-Off bus. We heard to stay in the Las Ramblas was very noisy and glad that we did not. This was well located with lovely comforts.We had 2 rooms, and they were both spacious. Breakfast was great (while you had to pay extra for it). The staff was very helpful, however one person at the desk did "tell" off another in front of us, and it was rather embrassing. That said, it that did not distract us, as both staff members were extremely helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kardex2dog
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Barcelona at the Granvia for 4 nights. The hotel has a lovely lounge - old and elegant. The staff were all very nice - some spoke english but let us practice our Spanish which was great fun. The room was plain but very clean. The location of the hotel was fabulous. We were able to walk to the Plaza Catalunya and explore the Rambles and the old area very well. The room faced a large street so was a little noisy which was fine when we closed the window. I would recommend this hotel - clean, simple, and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst experience I have had in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hodgie72
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4-night stay at the Gran Via on the recommendation of a friend. Upon arrival the receptionist completely ignored me and continued to stare at his computer despite the fact that I was stood in front of him. Eventually I was shown to a twin despite explicitly asking for a double. Back at reception the extremely rude receptionist informed me that 'its a double, but its not a double - understand?' Well, no, but I did when I was shown the room - the bed was about four feet wide and the room itself resembled a monastic cell. Back at reception I was told to take it or leave it, and that my partner was too big for the bed, not that the bed was too small. I took the twin for 1 night and checked out the next day, moving across Placa Catalunya to a lovely, friendly modern hotel for about 5 euros more per night. Even checkout was a horrible experience, conducted largely in silence with the receptionist gesturing for my credit card and pointing at the screen to show the amounts (and yes, he spoke English). I should point out that I am not difficult to please and have never felt the need to write in these terms before, but this place is an absolute shambles. My recommendations to The Gran Via are: Sack the receptionist and ensure he is never allowed to talk to the public again. Buy some decent furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: emjorden
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was incredibly rude and disrespectful. On 2 ocassions, 2 different staff members attempted to brush off my husband and I because they did not think we were guests. When my purse was stolen on the subway, the front desk denied they had a phone book (which he later brought out after he realized we were guests) and was reluctant to look up the US consolate phone number on the internet for us. Not to mention they knowingly gave us a room without airconditioning. When we asked the hotel to fix it, they said they couldnt get anyone out there that day so they gave us a new room across the hall. That night they knowingly put another set of guests in the horrible hot room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: GreywolfStamford
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and my two year old girl stayed here from June 30th to July 6th and had a wonderful time. The staff was professional and several members of the staff were absolutely fantastic. Senor Gomez, Manuel and Rafael were great. The location is perfect and close to everything. You can walk to so many places it is great. Las Ramlas is 5-7 minutes away by foot. What a great street. The Hotel is an old palace and it shows. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and breakfast was excellent. Overall we would definately recommend Gran Via and would go back again. We plan on going back again. AGH

Reviews.Title: “hated the noise”
Reviews.Author: madambutterfly26
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Granvia based on good reviews in a popular travel guide and reasonable price. I was a bit wary as to how busy the street Granvia would be so I requested a room on the back overlooking the terrace. The hotel replied that I would definitely get a quiet room on the back. I foolishly neglected to print this reply out and attach it to the usual confirmations. So we arrive ridiculously jetlagged and are assigned a room right on the front overlooking Granvia which has to be one of the busiest streets in Barcelona. Sleep was difficult to say the least. The hotel staff at Granvia are extremely unfriendly and almost unpleasant. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: GoddessT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grand and the public areas are beautiful. We had a triple room which was spacious, clean, and quiet, with a large closet, writing desk and in-room safe (extra charge). The beds however were too hard, basically a thin mattress on a hard board. Everything worked well in the bathroom, but there was a bit of foul odour from time to time. The eating room was lovely and the breakfast buffet was truly excellent (extra charge). Front desk staff were basically okay, although one young man rushed to carry my sister's suitcase up three stairways at midnight when she arrived by train. There is an elevator but it was briefly out of order.The location could not be better-walking distance to all the central highlights. Other than the hard beds, we loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modest Hotel in the middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: wunderlustee
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Barcelona, I picked this hotel based on location, price, and this review site. I am a single woman and I found this hotel to be absolutely convenient and extremely charming. The people at the front desk were very sweet. I had a room near the courtyard, meaning very little street noise, so it was a sanctuary of sorts after a day of walking and sightseeing. The ONLY drawback I can think of is that the walls between rooms were thin. It was rare during my 4 night stay, but I did hear my "neighbors" from time to time. Summary: Clean, Friendly, Reasonable, Convenient, Safe, Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: LERAPA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 2 nights at the Granvia while exploring Barcelona. We wish we had alloted more time. The location was very convenient--and what was not accessible by foot was easily reached via the subway station a block away. Furnishings were a bit warn, television selections were sparse, and the service at the desk was a bit cold, but overall the charm and convenience made for a very pleasant stay. Breakfast was very good, also.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved”
Reviews.Author: bluechick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in January 2008. We had just travelled from Madrid where we had had the tiniest room in the world in a noisy hotel. So when the desk clerk said we could have a twin room overlooking the courtyard which was quieter, or a twin room facing the street which would be noisier but bigger we were happy with either option. As it was we got a perfectly spacious room overlooking the courtyard. Not the shoebox I had envisioned! The decor is getting a little old but it was clean and roomy, in a fantastic location, and the desk staff were helpful and friendly. They also had free internet which was a bonus too. The hotel was a little bit more expensive than what we had hoped to pay but for what we got it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Granvia is incredibly convenient”
Reviews.Author: stephinberlin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located near many modes of public transport but also in walking distance to almost everything that we wanted to see. In fact, we walked everywhere except one time we took a bus. It is also in walking distance to the airport bus. Nice, clean, small hotel. Pretty entrance way and simple rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Via going down hill”
Reviews.Author: SJCNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Via a few years ago and found it reasonably priced, comfortable and charming (our room was pleasantly furnished in an antique style). The location remains the same-only a couple of blocks from the Palca Catalunya-therefore incredibly central-just jump off the airport bus and you're there. However, things seem to be going down hill-perhaps they gave all the best rooms away by the time we got there, but we found our rooms a bit shabby, the furniture scruffed up and the drains in one room smelled. The day porter was not too impressed when we asked to change rooms. Prices have gone up too. It's sad to see what used to be a shabby chic former palace become more shabby than chic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible day desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: jberk
Reviews.Content: The location and cleanliness of this hotel is very good, but our entire experience was soured by a mean, rude desk clerk. I booked the room via e-mail on the recommendation of the Rick Steves travel book. The clerk told me that he had a room available but that I must send my credit card number. I did not feel comfortable doing that over e-mail so he told me to just send the last 4 digits. I did this and then did not hear anything else from him. I assumed everything was fine. When I arrived at the hotel with copies of the correspondence he started yelling at me and telling me he never got my e-mail. He had rooms available to accomodate us, but still felt the need to yell at me for what was probably his fault. We needed another night at the hotel upon our return from Mallorca a few days later and he again made a stink saying that a festival was starting that day and that they were completely booked. He made no effort to help find us a room elsewhere. I cannot believe this man is employed in the service industry.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at the Hotel Granvia again”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut24
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was very clean and our triple room was very big with tons of space for your luggage and storage. It was quiet, we were in room 208 which was very nice. We had a pretty big bathroom as well and the room was always spotless. It was reasonably priced for europe. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast, it was too expensive and we don't eat much for breakfast anyway. The location of the hotel is perfect, you couldn't ask for a better location. It's very central and close to everything. It seems to be in a very safe neighbourhood and we were able to walk to la rambla, gothic quarter and port vell without any trouble. Placa Catalunya is right around the corner with subway station and tourist information as well. There is tons of shopping in the area as well!! The staff was okay. They weren't rude, they just didn't speak to us unless we spoke to them first. It would have been nice to have them at least say "hola". We never had any trouble when we asked for a taxi and no problems storing our luggage at the front desk. We were there to see Barcelona, not socialize with the staff anyway, so it was fine. One downfall was the lack of info about hotel ammenities. There was no info book in the room (like every hotel I have ever been to) to tell you what services are available in or around the hotel. For example, we had no idea the hotel had a terrace until now when I read about it in someone elses review. I also discovered the internet on my own and assumed it must have been free for guests considering the computer is sort of tucked away on the second level. The staff made no mention of any ammenities either. Over all, we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very charming and nicely decorated. We found it to be very clean, quiet and the staff was just very business like. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great for a Solo Woman Traveler!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Chick5
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona, Madrid, and Toledo at the beginning of the summer, and I stayed at the Granvia for four nights at the end of May. For a solo woman traveler, this place can’t be beat! LOCATION: The Granvia is located in the very safe Eixample area, very conveniently positioned about three blocks from the Placa Catalunya (where the airport shuttle drops you off). It was also within walking distance to the Barri Gottic and the Ramblas, but far enough away to be safe. There is a city bus directly across from the hotel that goes up to Montjuic and the Joan Miro museum, and another bus close by that goes up to Parc Guel. The hotel was also very close to several nice restaurants and shops – and it was near the El Corte Ingles, the massive department store that has a killer grocery store in the basement with everything you could ever want (including cheap bottled water, organic foods, fresh fruits, and yogurt -- which I badly needed after a week of consuming nothing but meat and beer). Best of all: I felt perfectly safe walking back to the hotel alone after dinner – even at 11pm or so. OTHER PERKS: Not only was the location great, but the hotel also had free Internet access (they have two computers in the wonderfully decorated parlor/drawing room upstairs, which you can access whenever you want to). There was also a lovely little area outside of the drawing room that had plants and benches. In the evenings, I noticed several guests relaxing outside with drinks, enjoying the nice weather. BREAKFAST: I really liked the breakfast buffet – it was well worth the money to me (I’m the type of person who absolutely cannot function without getting some food and coffee in my system before I leave the hotel). The buffet was huge, and from what I could tell, you could go back as many times as you wanted to in one sitting. I think it was 6-8 euros per day, but I can’t recall. There was this absolutely wonderful cheesecake-like baked thing that I just fell in love with, and lots of yogurts, fruits, cereals, and – of course – meat. I also loved the coffee machine – once I figured out that I had to hit the button 3 times to fill up the cup. There’s usually one woman working at the buffet to help you out – which is nice if you’re jetlagged, confused, and in bad need of caffeine like I was. STAFF: Overall, the staff members were great. It took a few days for them to warm up - as they were very professional - but eventually they did. I was particularly fond of the front desk clerk, who went out of his way to answer my questions on several occasions. The front desk staff and the security guards spoke fluent English, but the breakfast women and the maids did not. ADVICE: In general, don’t expect overly-effusive, “happy,” gushing responses from the staff in hotels and restaurants in Spain. The service industry in Spain is very professional, and they do their jobs efficiently and well. They don’t usually stand around or smile, joke, or laugh with you right off the bat. I noticed several Americans getting a bit huffy over this. My advice: don’t take it personally! These folks are at work, they’re busy, and they just want to do their jobs (the goal of which is to serve you your food or give you your hotel bill, not to become your best friend). It took me awhile to “get” this at first, but once I did, my trip went much smoother. I think it’s helpful to know this in advance. That way, when they ARE friendly and helpful (which happened on many occasions) it makes it that much nicer of an experience. :) ROOM: I had a single room with a double bed. I requested a quiet room and it was exactly that. The bed was very firm, and very comfortable. The room was immaculate, for which I was very grateful. There was a mini-fridge stocked full of waters, beer, and nuts and a little form on the night stand that I filled out when I took anything from the fridge. They totaled it at the end of my stay (and it wasn’t really that expensive). There was also a safe deposit box in room as well, which they charged for by the day. Note: This occurred at EVERY hotel I stayed at in Spain, and wasn’t expensive at all. It was well-worth the $1-$3 a day for the safe. In this particular hotel, I told them up front how many days I wanted to use it for, and paid for it in cash. Last thing: I emailed the hotel, and then booked directly with them via fax and got a nice discount. Overall, I was very, very pleased with this hotel, and I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest room in the world...”
Reviews.Author: eztur
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel with colleagues. I had a single room, which was extremely small. The smallest room I've ever been in. The furniture was old and smelled a bit. The bathroom was small, and my bath tub was the usual width but only about a meter long. Very small! Breakfast is okay, but no more than that. The personnel at the front desk is not very enthousiastic, nor helpful. Their english was poor. I did like the airco and the fact that all our rooms were next to each other.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Bobi73
Reviews.Content: Our initial opinion of Hotel Granvia was very favorable. The hotel clerk was friendly, spoke excellent English, and made us feel very comfortable. Our triple room was spacious and reasonably clean. The bathroom was small, and the towels a bit thin, but packets of shampoo, etc. were available, along with a hair dryer. Wi-fi is included, though it was somewhat difficult to maintain on the 5th floor. (The rooms start on the 3rd floor) The "bellman" was friendly and helpful. This is an old, sparcely furnished hotel, and the beds were hard, but not awful.There is a nice parlor and an outside courtyard on the 2nd level, as well as the restaurant, which we didn't use. The desk clerk we had the next morning was extremely unfriendly, and then was yelling at us when we weren't ready to take a taxi that my husband had told him not to call yet. We returned to the hotel a week later for 2 nights and had the same unfriendly reception. We were extremely relieved to encounter another friendly clerk when we were checking out, but the attitude of the older clerk with thin black hair was enough to make us steer clear of returning. The price from the website and location were excellent; close to Los Ramblas, but very quiet. Definitely a hotel to consider, but take your thick skin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but........”
Reviews.Author: TooManyShoes
Reviews.Content: Hotel GranVia has a wonderful location. The building and furnishings were a nice mix of new and Faded Lady. But the staff ranged from indifferent to rude. When we arrived before noon (because the ship docked quite early) to leave our bags and do a preliminary check-in, the man at the desk was actually angry! Who knows what was going on elsewhere in his life. Maybe he was acting out on the hapless tourists, but we will never forget his jaw-dropping rudeness. The GranVia staff were the only people in all of Barcelona who were rather unpleasant to us! Barcelona is a beautiful city. We will certainly go back. However, we will look for a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel -- Very comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AJFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Gran Via street about 200 yards from Plaza Catalunya, 3 min. walk from Rambla, 5 min. walk from Casa Mila and Casa Battla, 30 feet from a Metro station and next door to a car park. You can't find anything more convenient. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable with a good AC. We stayed in a triple room where the third bed was built into a sofa and did not have to be squeezed in. The public areas were fancy and there was free internet. Con's: This is not a fancy 5 star hotel. Service is adequate but not much more. Reception is always too busy to help you too much and the Bellman is missing most of the time but all this did not matter much to us. Breakfast is fine but probably not worth Euro 13

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NeverDriveInScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2007 in a triple room which was quite spacious and comfortable with a large bathroom. Hotel's public areas are beautiful. Free internet available in the lounge. Staff was friendly. Convenient location within 5 minute walk of Placa de Cataluyna, Las Ramblas, Passeo de Gracia, airport bus stop, and cafes. Metro and public bus stop within a block. On our first afternoon while trying to rest, we were disturbed by very loud music during happy hour from around 4-6 in the afternoon. Otherwise noise was not a problem, although the walls seemed a little thin and we did hear other guests at times. Our room was on the interior so weren't bothered at all by traffic noise. My only real concern was the lack of electronic locks/key for the doors. A hotel of this caliber should have this safety feature. Overall our stay was pleasant and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: ttrail199
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay at the end of May, 2007 at the hotel and really enjoyed it. The location was terrific since it was only a few block walk to Plaza Cataluna. Our room was large, it overlooked the bustling street and it was very clean. The staff was helpful. All factors led to a great overall stay. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: LongWeekenderHaworth
Reviews.Content: Got back from our 3 night stay at The Gran Via last night. After reading some of the previous mixed reviews we were wondering what to expect but were greeted warmly by the man on reception and our room (112) was absolutely fine - a fairly large room with ample storage space (including a small walk in wardrobe), a firm double bed, a balcony looking over the courtyard at the back , which proved to be a good choice as we couldn't hear the traffic from the busy road at the front of the hotel. We only had one pillow each and asked for 2 more at reception but they had not arrived by our return that first evening, but they soon sorted us out after a reminder. We had fresh clean towels every day and the linen was clean and of good quality The room was quite warm which we thought would perhaps be a problem in the summer months, although there was an air conditioning unit which wasn't working - it was probably turned off at a master switch. We were unsure of what to do for breakfast as most hotel's offerings of continental breakfast leave you still hungry, but we needn't have worried as there was such a reasonable selection of both hot and cold food of which you could have as much as you liked. The coffee was delightful!! The breakfast worked out at 10 Euros per head and the amount we ate would have cost so much more had we gone to the nearby cafes. Also the breakfast room was immaculate and very grand with 3 chandeliers and ornate furnishings The hotel was a bit dusty in the corridors and the carpets needed hoovering but overall it was clean. For a hotel of this age we were surprised that the walls were so thin, fortunately we had considerate neighbours. The hotel is close to Las Ramblas and ideally situated for the upmarket shops on Passeig de Gracia and the 2 Gaudi museums. The stops for the tourist buses are about a five minute walk away. Also the Metro is just 50 metres to the left of the hotel. Beware of the 7% tax which will be added to your bill on departure. If we were visiting Barcelona again we would happily stay at The Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “Funereal”
Reviews.Author: flacoLA
Reviews.Content: This gand old mansion has seen better days. We knew we were in trouble when we were greeted by the brittle, dried up Christmas tree standing in the lobby. The staff is sullen at best and the rooms where depressing. True, the public areas have a certain eccentric, faded-grandeur but they leave one feeling that Franco's ghost might appear at any moment. This all could have been laughed off if it weren't for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: romaboots
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed twice at the Gran Via, once in Sept. 2004 and again in Sept. 2000. The location can't be beat as it's within walking distance of many of the major sites, museum and shopping. Our rooms both times were spacious with large comfortable beds and nice furnishings. On our second stay we had a room with a balcony overlooking the street and rooftops of Barcelona. The breakfast room is lovely and the hotel has a restored elegance that is very charming. The service was excellent and we highly recommend the Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “very Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel-TA
Reviews.Content: The Gran Via really has it all. It is absolutely lovely, clean, well located with a helpful staff. I have booked again for next year. Would not stay anywhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored palace”
Reviews.Author: DiTone
Reviews.Content: Altho' we knew it was a restored palace, we didn't expect it to be so well restored! It is jaw-dropping with its huge, museum-like space. The room with breakfast (the best coffee we had found in our entire trip) was a huge and beautifully appointed drawing room and even the computers available were in some sort of large and gorgeous room overlooking a patio area. Walking distance from most everything you would expect to visit in Barcelona - what a great and energetic city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: jlsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gran Via. What a grand hotel. It was 100% old world charm. Wonderful location. Staff and accomodations were top notch. Barcelona is beautiful and exciting. Lots to see. Great tourist bus system too.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Great Location..........”
Reviews.Author: Julay
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a great location as many other reviewers have mentioned. We stayed there for 3 nights in August. Looks like most of the hotel rooms have been renovated but left the beautiful charm of the old hotel. Room was small, but very clean with a full bath. Double bed. AC worked fine. TV in the room and also a mini-bar. Free internet on 3 computers in the hotel and 2.50 Euros per night for the key to the safe (not 7 Euros as someone else mentioned). I am Spanish (but live in the US) so may be they rip off the "foreigners". That would be a shame. My wife is 6 months pregnant so I asked the cleaning ladies for more pillows and they were very nice and gave me 3 extras. All in all a good deal for a decent hotel in a great location. Would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Why So Mean?”
Reviews.Author: italymaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel, with a good central location and adequate rooms, suffers from rude and hostile staff. We asked them to make a reservation at one place for dinner and they said it wasn't necessary. We got to the restaurant and there was no room. We asked for a reservation at another place, they said they didn't know of it and so we would have to find the phone number and call ourselves. Directions (if provided) were often wrong. On the plus side, breakfast was bountiful for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: moushy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granvia has an excellent location - really near the Placa Catalunya and within easy reach of major attractions, including all 'modernista' buidings and Las Ramblas. The hotel itself was a little disappointing. This is european standard 3*. The first room we were shown looked out onto an enclosed internal courtyard. The courtyard had a glass roof so the air inside the courtyard was hot and stuffy - this made our room intolerable. My husband ended up sleeping on the cold wood floor to cool down. This first room was cramped, dirty and the air-conditioning did not work. When we went to ask for the air-con to be fixed we were told that it was not working in any of the rooms. We requested a room transfer and this was arranged. The second room was a definite improvement - much larger, cleaner and with a window that opened onto fresh air. The breakfast was of a good standard - plenty of choice. But, overall, the service really let this place down. We asked the concierge: 'can we have a cup of tea' (being english!) and his reply was a curt 'no' as he peered up from behind his newspaper. The lifts didn't work during our stay. The rooms were not super clean. The price and the location are great though.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an excellent location near Catalunya and between the pg. de Gracia shopping street and the lively Ramlas. The rooms are basic, some with half baths, ie. a small bath tub that allows standing room only - but the water pressure is good. Walls are too thin - I was lucky that everyone in the adjacent rooms were courtious and didn't make alot of noise at night. Didn't spend much time in the hotel, since the there is a lot to see, so I can't comment on other amenities. Didn't eat in the hotel. They charge you about 7 euros a day for the key to the safe in your room - ( i hate when hotels do petty things like that!) The rooms were cleaned every day and standard items were replaced. The reception staff that greeted me spoke English and was helpful. I would stay here again for the location and convenience. Barcelona is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic massive quad room, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Via for one night only, we travelled with our two children and had a quad room.. I think we must have had the biggest room in the hotel - it was like an apartment minus the kitchen. Huge ceilings with grand double doors to enter - It had a living area with a huge fireplace, bookcases table, etc and there were four beds still with loads and loads of space. You had a walk in wardrobe area and then a huge bathroom. To top it all you had your own little balcony with chairs overlooking the roof terrace which to our amazement had a childrens old fashioned play area! Perfect!! Its such a shame we were only here for one evening. It cost us about 100.00 english pounds. We can't say what the other rooms were like but ours was like a palace - great location in the middle of everything as well. I can't remember what the room number was unfortunately - I know we had trouble finding it because the room number wasn't on the door and we had to ask

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT location in the heart of town. Walking distance to many Eixample sights. About 8 minutes from Las Ramblas. Staff pleasant. Room clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good. My only recommendation is that you take a Spanish dictionary as not all the staff speak English, which is reflective of the Spanish population. They do all speak French. Price reasonable for what you get; location is everything. Safe neighborhood with nice restaurants around the corner. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur but with a lot of personality”
Reviews.Author: ltmoira
Reviews.Content: My father and i stayed for five days in Barcelona at this hotel and found it perfectly acceptable. It's not the fanciest place in the world, but the rooms were very pleasantly appointed and clean. The lounges and breakfast rooms, though, were quite beautiful and well kept. Also the hotel's location -- near Placa Catalunya, and the Corte Ingles, a short walk from both the Ramblas and the Passeig de Gracia -- was a major plus. We loved walking around Barcelona and the Gran Via was well situated for that. Owner Juan and his staff were very helpful with everything from dinner and theater reservations to finding a laundry. The breakfast was better than the average hotel selection, although, as always, you can certainly find a wide range of good breakfast places in that area for lower prices. We had booked a double with twin beds (not through an online service, but via email correspondence) and when we arrived, they had somehow put us down for a double with a single bed. Does no hotel in Europe understand what is requested when you ask for two separate beds? Nevertheless, there was no problem changing to a double with twin beds and we were given a room facing over the main street, but the noise did not bother us at all. For the price, we felt we couldn't have done better and were very pleased with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “great location, a bit too noisy”
Reviews.Author: bostonbased
Reviews.Content: hotel location is super, close to many interesting areas/sites. staff were very friendly and helpful. smoking in public areas may be improved with recent no-smoking laws, but in December the entire hotel smelled of cigarette smoke, like most other places in Barcelona. free internet in hotel common room was very nice, but a couple of days really slow, internet cafe across the street was less than 1 euro for 15 minutes (high-speed access). walls and courtyards did not protect light sleepers from hearing normal tone-of-voice conversations in the next room or when a neighboring room had their courtyard window open. rooms nicely renovated, comfortable, firm mattress, and BBC on the television. did not try hotel breakfast, as so many cafe's nearby with affordable coffee, pastries, etc.
